vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider

vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider Class Reference

XXX Interface for working with Context/Command Indicator Fields (CIFs) XXX. More...

#include <IndicatorFields.h>

int64_t getBufferStatus (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const
 Gets Buffer Size, Level, and Status (See V49.2 spec Section 9.10.7) Bits 63-32 | Buffer Sz | Size in bytes (assume 32-bit integer) Bits 31-16 | Reserved | Fixed value of 0x0 Bits 15-8 | Level | Indicates buffer utilization: empty <=> 0x0; full <=> (either 0x80 if one-hot, or 0xFF; user-defined) Bits 7-0 | Status | Used to indicate buffer underrun/overrun/etc.
int32_t getBuildVersion (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const
 Gets Build Version Information (See V49.2 spec Section 9.10.4) bits 31-25 | Year | Year compiled; Values map linearly such that 0 => year 2000, up to 127 => year 2127 bits 24-16 | Day | Day of year compiled; Valid values are 1..366, where 1 => Jan 1 (? 366 is for leap year/seconds?) bits 15-10 | Revision | Used to distinguish between versions made on the same day, allowing up to 64 revisions per day bits 9-0 | User Def | User defined info associated with the build.

float vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::get3DPointingVectorAzimuth ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets the Azimuthal Angle subfield of the Single-word 3D Pointing Vector.

(See V49.2 spec Section 9.4.1)

  • Bits 31..16: Elevation angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 23; range [-90,90]
  • Bits 15..0: Azimuthal angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 7; range [0,512)

virtual ArrayOfRecords vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::get3DPointingVectorStructured ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [pure virtual]

Gets the 3D Pointing Vector (Structured) See V49.2 spec Section 9.4.1.

Array-of-Records format HeaderSize is either 0 or 1

  • Note: docs say 3 or 4, but that's inconsistent with definition of ArrayOfRecords, so ignoring that guidance 3 or 4 must include the required 3 words of every ArrayOfRecords, which is incorrect.
  • depends on whether optional App-Specific Header is included, which is a 32-bit word if so
  • optional App-Specific Header is a *Global* Index/Ref/Beam subfield NumWords/Record is either 1 or 2
  • depends on whether optional Index/Ref/Beam subfield is included in each record Bitmapped CIF subfield only uses bits 31 and 30
  • Bit 31: Set when each record includes the optional Index/Ref/Beam subfield
  • Bit 30: Always set; Indicates presence of 3D Pointing Vector subfield in each record, which is required App-Specific header is optional 32-bit word
  • as mentioned above, this is a *Global* Index/Ref/Beam subfield Each Record is at most 2 words
  • First 32-bit word is optional, and is the Index/Ref/Beam subfield
  • Second 32-bit word is required, and is the 3D Pointing Vector subfield Index/Ref/Beam subfield
  • Bits 31..16: Record Index (optional; 0 when global or unused in records)
  • Bits 15..4: Reserved
  • Bits 3..2: Reference (00 not specified; 01 ECEF; 10 Platform centered; 11 Array centered)
  • Bits 1..0: Beam (00 not specified; 01 Beam or signal direction; 10 Null; 11 reserved) 3D Pointing Vector subfield
  • Bits 31..16: Elevation angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 23; range [-90,90]
  • Bits 15..0: Azimuthal angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 7; range [0,512)
    Parameters:
    cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
    Returns:
    3D Pointing Vector as an Array-of-Records (null if not specified). Note that changes to the returned object do not alter the packet.

Implemented in vrt::BasicAcknowledgePacket, and vrt::BasicContextPacket.

Referenced by set3DPointingVectorStructured().

Air temperature in degrees Celcius. The valid range of values is from -273.15 to +511.984375 degrees Celcius. Bits 31..16: Reserved; 0x0 Bits 15..0: 16-bit floating point value with radix point to the right of bit 6. See V49.2 spec Section 9.9.2 for Air Temperature

float vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getAuxGain1 ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets the Stage 1 Auxiliary Gain of the device in dB.

This is a second front-end gain control/metadata field for control and reporting on anciliary hardware or processing in a single chain described by a single Stream ID. In cases where a separate Stage 1 and Stage 2 gain is not necessary, this holds the total aux gain of the system and Stage 2 Auxiliary Gain is set to zero. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.15)

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The stage 1 aux gain (null if not specified).

References vrt::IndicatorFields::AUX_GAIN, getI(), and vrt::VRTMath::toFloat16().

This is a second back-end gain control/metadata field for control and reporting on anciliary hardware or processing in a single chain described by a single Stream ID. In cases where a separate Stage 1 and Stage 2 gain is not necessary, Stage 1 Auxiliary Gain holds the total aux gain of the system and this is set to zero. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.15)

Gets Buffer Size, Level, and Status (See V49.2 spec Section 9.10.7) Bits 63-32 | Buffer Sz | Size in bytes (assume 32-bit integer) Bits 31-16 | Reserved | Fixed value of 0x0 Bits 15-8 | Level | Indicates buffer utilization: empty <=> 0x0; full <=> (either 0x80 if one-hot, or 0xFF; user-defined) Bits 7-0 | Status | Used to indicate buffer underrun/overrun/etc.

; user-defined

Gets Build Version Information (See V49.2 spec Section 9.10.4) bits 31-25 | Year | Year compiled; Values map linearly such that 0 => year 2000, up to 127 => year 2127 bits 24-16 | Day | Day of year compiled; Valid values are 1..366, where 1 => Jan 1 (? 366 is for leap year/seconds?) bits 15-10 | Revision | Used to distinguish between versions made on the same day, allowing up to 64 revisions per day bits 9-0 | User Def | User defined info associated with the build.

int32_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getCIF7Belief ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  field  )  const [inline]

Get CIF7 BELIEF Attribute of a field Conveys a factor conveying the degree of confidence that the probability is accurate.

virtual int32_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getCIF7Offset ( int32_t  attr,
int32_t  len,
bool  occurrence = 0 
) const [inline, protected, virtual]

Gets the offset of the CIF7 attribute, INCLUDING the attribute This offset needs to be calculated differently because a value of 0 is permitted, and we can't return -0 to indicate not present.

Instead, offset is from the start of the parent non-CIF7 field and includes the entire CIF7 attribute indicated. This is essentially an offset to the end of the field instead of the beginning. It can be easily adjusted by the calling function by reducing the magnitude by the length of the CIF7 attribute (i.e. getFieldLen(7,attr,len) ).

Parameters:
attr CIF7 attribute bitmask
len Length of the parent field
occurrence False (0) if first occurrence (default; almost everything), True (1) if second occurrence (only Errors for BasicAcknowledgePacket)
Returns:
Offset from start of the parent field to the end of CIF7 attribute
Exceptions:
VRTException for classes that do not support CIF7.

Reimplemented in vrt::BasicAcknowledgePacket, and vrt::BasicContextPacket.

int32_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getCIF7Probability ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  field  )  const [inline]

Get CIF7 PROBABILITY Attribute of a field Conveys the probability of the selected field of being accurate or true.

Bits 31..16: Reserved (0x0) Bits 15..8: Probability Function 0x00 = Uniformed Distribution 0x01 = Normal Distribution 0x02 to 0xFF = User Defined Bits 7..0: Probability % 0xFF = 100% 0x00 = 0% 0x01 = 1/255 of 100%

Parameters:
field IndicatorFieldEnum of target field
Returns:
val PROBABILITY value

References getL(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::PROBABILITY.

int64_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getDuration ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets Duration Duration expresses the length of time that a pattern in a signal existed (Context Packets) or should exist (Command Packets).

Duration uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Duration See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The Duration (null if not specified)

int64_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getDwell ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets Dwell Dwell expresses the length of time that a signal existed (Context Packets) or should exist (Command Packets).

Dwell uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Dwell See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The Dwell (null if not specified)

References vrt::IndicatorFields::DWELL, and getX().

float vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getEbN0 ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets the Energy per Bit to Noise Density ratio (Eb/N0).

Valid range is from -256dB to +255.984375dB (= 0x7FFE), with the maximum positive value (0x7FFF) designating the "Eb/N0 not used" case. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.17)

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

int16_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getEmsDeviceClass ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets EMS Device Class Conveys the general type of sensor used to generate the signal such as radar, communications, beacon.

The enumeration may also represent sub- classes such as search radar, navigation radar, broadcast commercial FM station, SATCOM, cellular, public safety radio or military radio. EMS Device Class uses the Generic16 bit Identifier field Bits 15..14: General organization relationship {00: Coalition, 01: Known, 10: Unknown, 11: Reserved} Bit 13: Set if device is exciter Bit 12: Set if device is receiver Bits 11..0: enumeration of general type of EMS device See V49.2 spec Section 9.8.9 for EMS Device Class See V49.2 spec Section 9.8 for Generic16 bit Identifier field

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The EMS Device Class (null if not specified)

int64_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getFallTime ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets Fall Time Fall Time is the delta time from 90% of maximum deviation to 10% of maximum deviation.

Deviation is referenced to the noise floor of the signal. Fall Time uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Fall Time See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

virtual GeoSentences vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getGeoSentences ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [pure virtual]

Gets the GPS ASCII "sentences".

These are ASCII "sentences" from a GPS (Global Positioning System) receiver, such as those conforming to NMEA-0183. Due to the great variety in GPS "sentences", this class makes little effort to do anything useful with them. Users are encouraged to use getGeolocationGPS() which essentially provides the same information, but in a consistent form.

Parameters:

Returns:

virtual int32_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getOffset ( int8_t  cifNum,
int32_t  field 
) const [protected, pure virtual]

Gets the offset for the given context indicator field relative to the location of the first occurrence of CIF0.

For access to the second occurrence of CIFs (i.e. Error fields in Ack packets), add 8 to the CIF number, effectively setting the 4th bit (mod8 gives field, div8 gives occurrence).

Parameters:
cifNum number of CIF that field belongs to.
field bitmask associated with field of interest.
Returns:
offset in bytes from beginning of CIF payload, or CIF7 as described above.
Exceptions:
VRTException If the CIF number is invalid.

Implemented in vrt::BasicAcknowledgePacket, and vrt::BasicContextPacket.

Referenced by getRange(), and setUserDefinedBits().

int64_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getPulseWidth ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets Pulse Width Pulse Width measures the delta time between two timing edges of a signal.

It measures the time between the rising edge and falling edge of a signal or vice versa. Pulse Width uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Pulse Width See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The Pulse Width (null if not specified)

int64_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getRiseTime ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets Rise Time Rise Time is the delta time from 10% of maximum deviation to 90% of maximum deviation.

Deviation is referenced to the noise floor of the signal. Rise Time uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Rise Time See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The Rise Time (null if not specified)

int16_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getSeaAndSwellState ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets Sea and Swell State Sea and Swell States use the Douglas sea and swell scale as officially defined by the United Kingdom MetOffice in "Fact Sheet No. 6".

Sea and Swell States are each a number between 0 and 9. Bits 31..16: Reserved (property of all Generic16 bit Identifier fields) Bits 15..10: User Defined Bits 9..5: Swell State Bits 4..0: Sea State Sea and Swell State uses the Generic16 bit Identifier field See V49.2 spec Section 9.9.1 for Sea and Swell State See V49.2 spec Section 9.8 for Generic16 bit Identifier field

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The Sea and Swell State (null if not specified)

References getI(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE.

float vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getSeaGroundTemperature ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets the Sea/Ground Temperature.

Sea or ground temperature in degrees Celcius. The valid range of values is from -273.15 to +511.984375 degrees Celcius. Bits 31..16: Reserved; 0x0 Bits 15..0: 16-bit floating point value with radix point to the right of bit 6. See V49.2 spec Section 9.9.2 for Sea/Ground Temperature

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The Sea/Ground Temperature (null if not specified).

References getI(), vrt::IndicatorFields::SEA_GROUND_TEMP, and vrt::VRTMath::toFloat16().

int64_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getTimestampDetails ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets Timestamp Details Timestamp Details describes the timestamps used in the Context Stream and the paired Data Stream (if present).

First Word: Bits 31..24: User Defined Bits 23..19: Reserved; 0x0 Bit 18: (G) Globally applicable? Bits 17..16: (TSE Code) Type of Timestamp Epoch provided Bits 15..14: (LSH Code) Indicates the means by which leap seconds are handled in the packet timestamps Bits 13..12: (LSP Code) Indicates the number of seconds in the current day denoted by the packet timestamps Bits 11..9: (Time Source) Indicates time reference source being used Bit 8: (E) If 0, Current POSIX Time Offset is undefined. If 1, Current POSIX Time Offset conveys the difference in seconds between UTC time and POSIX time, as a signed twos-complement number, and it represents the total leap seconds count. Bits 7..0: (Current POSIX Time Offset) See Bit 8 (E) Second Word: Bits 31..0: (Timestamp Epoch) Unsigned integer value specifying the number of whole seconds, in the epoch denoted by the TSE Code, describing the start of the epoch used for timestamps in all packets to which the Timestamp Details field applies. When the TSE Code is set to Unspecified, the value in the Timestamp Epoch field has no meaning. See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.3.4 for Timestamp Details

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The Timestamp Details (null if not specified)

References getX(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::TIMESTAMP_DETAILS.

int32_t vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getUserDefinedBits ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline]

Gets the User-Defined Bits from the State and Event Indicator Bits.

The definition of these bits should be included in the documentation for the relevent packet class. Unlike other bits of the State and Event Indicator Field, there is no concept of an undefined-value for user bits if the State and Event Indicator Field is present to support some other bits. As such, zero will be returned if the State and Event Indicator Field is absent.

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
true if the flag is set, false if it is not set, zero if the State and Event Indicator Field is absent.

References getB(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::STATE_EVENT.

Gets the valid data indicator flag. 

    true  = The data in the packet is valid
    false = A condition exists that *may* invalidate some or all of the data in the packet
    null  = This information is not available

Note that the definition of "valid" and "invalid" data is application specific, so it is important to conslut the documentation for the relevent packet class before using this field.

Parameters:
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
true if the flag is set, false if it is not set, null if this optional flag isn't specified (null is returned for all context packets).

References vrt::IndicatorFields::getCIFBitMask(), vrt::IndicatorFields::getCIFNumber(), and getStateEventBit().

    false = No discontinuities present

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::set3DPointingVectorAzimuth ( float  val,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the Azimuthal Angle subfield of the Single-word 3D Pointing Vector.

If no Elevation Angle has been specified, it will be set to zero following the call to this method. If set to null, both Elevation and Azimuthal Angles will be set to null. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.4.1)

  • Bits 31..16: Elevation angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 23; range [-90,90]
  • Bits 15..0: Azimuthal angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 7; range [0,512)
    Parameters:
    val The Azimuthal Angle (null if not specified).
    cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

References vrt::VRTMath::fromFloat16(), vrt::IndicatorFields::PNT_VECT_3D_SI, setI(), and setL().

  • Bits 15..0: Azimuthal angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 7; range [0,512)

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::set3DPointingVectorStructured ( const ArrayOfRecords &  val,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the 3D Pointing Vector (Structured) See V49.2 spec Section 9.4.1.

Array-of-Records format HeaderSize is either 0 or 1

  • Note: docs say 3 or 4, but that's inconsistent with definition of ArrayOfRecords, so ignoring that guidance 3 or 4 must include the required 3 words of every ArrayOfRecords, which is incorrect.
  • depends on whether optional App-Specific Header is included, which is a 32-bit word if so
  • optional App-Specific Header is a *Global* Index/Ref/Beam subfield NumWords/Record is either 1 or 2
  • depends on whether optional Index/Ref/Beam subfield is included in each record Bitmapped CIF subfield only uses bits 31 and 30
  • Bit 31: Set when each record includes the optional Index/Ref/Beam subfield
  • Bit 30: Always set; Indicates presence of 3D Pointing Vector subfield in each record, which is required App-Specific header is optional 32-bit word
  • as mentioned above, this is a *Global* Index/Ref/Beam subfield Each Record is at most 2 words
  • First 32-bit word is optional, and is the Index/Ref/Beam subfield
  • Second 32-bit word is required, and is the 3D Pointing Vector subfield Index/Ref/Beam subfield
  • Bits 31..16: Record Index (optional; 0 when global or unused in records)
  • Bits 15..4: Reserved
  • Bits 3..2: Reference (00 not specified; 01 ECEF; 10 Platform centered; 11 Array centered)
  • Bits 1..0: Beam (00 not specified; 01 Beam or signal direction; 10 Null; 11 reserved) 3D Pointing Vector subfield
  • Bits 31..16: Elevation angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 23; range [-90,90]
  • Bits 15..0: Azimuthal angle in degrees; radix point to the right of bit 7; range [0,512)
    Parameters:
    val The 3D Pointing Vector as an Array-of-Records (null if not specified).
    cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

References get3DPointingVectorStructured(), vrt::IndicatorFields::PNT_VECT_3D_ST, and setRecord().

Sets the Total Auxiliary Gain of the device in dB.

This is effectively the same as setAuxGain(val,0) except that setAuxGain(null) will mark both aux gain values as unspecified. (Note that it is not possible to specify one of the aux gain values and leave the other as unspecified.) (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.15)

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::setAuxGain1 ( float  val,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the Stage 1 Auxiliary Gain of the device in dB.

This is a second front-end gain control/metadata field for control and reporting on anciliary hardware or processing in a single chain described by a single Stream ID. In cases where a separate Stage 1 and Stage 2 gain is not necessary, this holds the total aux gain of the system and Stage 2 Auxiliary Gain is set to zero. If no Stage 2 Auxiliary Gain has been specified, it will be set to 0 following the call to this method. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.15)

Parameters:
val The stage 1 aux gain (null if not specified).
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

References vrt::IndicatorFields::AUX_GAIN, vrt::VRTMath::fromFloat16(), and setI().

IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the Stage 2 Auxiliary Gain of the device in dB.

This is a second back-end gain control/metadata field for control and reporting on anciliary hardware or processing in a single chain described by a single Stream ID. In cases where a separate Stage 1 and Stage 2 gain is not necessary, Stage 1 Auxiliary Gain holds the total aux gain of the system and this is set to zero. If no Stage 1 Auxiliary Gain has been specified, it will be set to 0 following the call to this method. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.15)

IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the Bit Error Rate (BER).

Valid range is from -256dB to +255.984375dB (= 0x7FFE), with the maximum positive value (0x7FFF) designating the "BER not used" case. If no Eb/N0 has been specified, it will be set to zero following the call to this method. If set to null, both Eb/N0 and BER will be set to null. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.17)

Sets Buffer Size, Level, and Status (See V49.2 spec Section 9.10.7) Bits 63-32 | Buffer Sz | Size in bytes (assume 32-bit integer) Bits 31-16 | Reserved | Fixed value of 0x0 Bits 15-8 | Level | Indicates buffer utilization: empty <=> 0x0; full <=> (either 0x80 if one-hot, or 0xFF; user-defined) Bits 7-0 | Status | Used to indicate buffer underrun/overrun/etc.

) [inline]

Sets Build Version Information (See V49.2 spec Section 9.10.4) bits 31-25 | Year | Year compiled; Values map linearly such that 0 => year 2000, up to 127 => year 2127 bits 24-16 | Day | Day of year compiled; Valid values are 1..366, where 1 => Jan 1 (? 366 is for leap year/seconds?) bits 15-10 | Revision | Used to distinguish between versions made on the same day, allowing up to 64 revisions per day bits 9-0 | User Def | User defined info associated with the build.

Set CIF7 BELIEF Attribute of a field Conveys a factor conveying the degree of confidence that the probability is accurate.

Bits 31..8: Reserved (0x0) Bits 7..0: Belief % 0xFF = 100% 0x00 = 0% 0x01 = 1/255 of 100%

int32_t  val 
) [inline]

Set CIF7 PROBABILITY Attribute of a field Conveys the probability of the selected field of being accurate or true.

Bits 31..16: Reserved (0x0) Bits 15..8: Probability Function 0x00 = Uniformed Distribution 0x01 = Normal Distribution 0x02 to 0xFF = User Defined Bits 7..0: Probability % 0xFF = 100% 0x00 = 0% 0x01 = 1/255 of 100%

Sets Country Code The ISO 3166 Numeric code or user-defined code for a country.

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::setEbN0 ( float  val,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the Energy per Bit to Noise Density ratio (Eb/N0).

Valid range is from -256dB to +255.984375dB (= 0x7FFE), with the maximum positive value (0x7FFF) designating the "Eb/N0 not used" case. If no BER has been specified, it will be set to zero following the call to this method. If set to null, both Eb/N0 and BER will be set to null. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.17)

Parameters:
val The Eb/N0 (null if not specified).
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets Fall Time Fall Time is the delta time from 90% of maximum deviation to 10% of maximum deviation.

Deviation is referenced to the noise floor of the signal. Fall Time uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Fall Time See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

This is the front-end gain of the system. In cases where a separate Stage 1 and Stage 2 gain is not necessary, this holds the total gain of the system and Gain 2 is set to zero. If no stage 2 gain has been specified, it will be set to 0 following the call to this method.

Sets the GPS ASCII "sentences".

Users are encouraged to use getGeolocationGPS() which essentially provides the same information, but in a consistent form.

IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the Noise Figure of the receiver, expressed in decibels.

The Noise Figure of a receiver is a measure of the reduction in the SNR between the input of the receiver (the antenna) to the output of the RF processing chain. If no SNR has been specified, it will be set to 0 following the call to this method. If set to null, both SNR and Noise Figure will be set to null. (See V49.2 spec Section 9.5.7)

) [inline]

Offset Time uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Offset Time See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets Rise Time Rise Time is the delta time from 10% of maximum deviation to 90% of maximum deviation.

Deviation is referenced to the noise floor of the signal. Rise Time uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for Rise Time See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::setSeaAndSwellState ( int8_t  sea,
int8_t  swell,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets Sea and Swell State Sea and Swell States use the Douglas sea and swell scale as officially defined by the United Kingdom MetOffice in "Fact Sheet No. 6".

Sea and Swell States are each a number between 0 and 9. Bits 31..16: Reserved (property of all Generic16 bit Identifier fields) Bits 15..10: User Defined Bits 9..5: Swell State Bits 4..0: Sea State Sea and Swell State uses the Generic16 bit Identifier field See V49.2 spec Section 9.9.1 for Sea and Swell State See V49.2 spec Section 9.8 for Generic16 bit Identifier field

Parameters:
sea The Sea State [0 to 9], not null
swell The Swell State [0 to 9], not null
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Exceptions:
VRTException if either parameter is invalid, including null

References vrt::IndicatorFields::SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE, and setI().

Sea or ground temperature in degrees Celcius. The valid range of values is from -273.15 to +511.984375 degrees Celcius. Bits 31..16: Reserved; 0x0 Bits 15..0: 16-bit floating point value with radix point to the right of bit 6. See V49.2 spec Section 9.9.2 for Sea/Ground Temperature

References setL(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::TIME_CALIB.

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::setTimestampDetails ( int64_t  val,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets Timestamp Details Timestamp Details describes the timestamps used in the Context Stream and the paired Data Stream (if present).

First Word: Bits 31..24: User Defined Bits 23..19: Reserved; 0x0 Bit 18: (G) Globally applicable? Bits 17..16: (TSE Code) Type of Timestamp Epoch provided Bits 15..14: (LSH Code) Indicates the means by which leap seconds are handled in the packet timestamps Bits 13..12: (LSP Code) Indicates the number of seconds in the current day denoted by the packet timestamps Bits 11..9: (Time Source) Indicates time reference source being used Bit 8: (E) If 0, Current POSIX Time Offset is undefined. If 1, Current POSIX Time Offset conveys the difference in seconds between UTC time and POSIX time, as a signed twos-complement number, and it represents the total leap seconds count. Bits 7..0: (Current POSIX Time Offset) See Bit 8 (E) Second Word: Bits 31..0: (Timestamp Epoch) Unsigned integer value specifying the number of whole seconds, in the epoch denoted by the TSE Code, describing the start of the epoch used for timestamps in all packets to which the Timestamp Details field applies. When the TSE Code is set to Unspecified, the value in the Timestamp Epoch field has no meaning. See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.3.4 for Timestamp Details

Parameters:
val The Timestamp Details (null if not specified)
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

References setX(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::TIMESTAMP_DETAILS.

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::setTimestampSkew ( int64_t  val,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets Timestamp Skew Timestamp Skew conveys a time offset between channels in a system or between systems in a distributed system-of-systems architecture.

Timestamp Skew uses the 64-bit Fractional Time format where the least significant bit represents 1 femtosecond (10e-15 seconds). See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.3.2 for Timestamp Skew See V49.2 spec Section 9.7 for Fractional Time format

Parameters:
val The Timestamp Skew (null if not specified)
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

References setX(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::TIMESTAMP_SKEW.

) [inline]

Sets Track ID A dynamic number that is generated during operations used to indicate that information from a specrum observation or a set of spectrum observations over time is associated.

Track ID uses the Generic32 bit Identifier field See V49.2 spec Section 9.8.6 for Track ID See V49.2 spec Section 9.8 for Generic32 bit Identifier field

Parameters:

void vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::setUserDefinedBits ( int32_t  val,
IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL 
) [inline]

Sets the User-Defined Bits from the State and Event Indicator Bits.

The definition of these bits should be included in the documentation for the relevent packet class. Unlike other bits of the State and Event Indicator Field, there is no concept of an undefined-value for user bits if the State and Event Indicator Field is present to support some other bits. As such, no "null value" is supported for the user-defined buts.

Parameters:
val true if the flag is set, false if it is not set.
cif7field (Optional) Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.

References getOffset(), setB(), and vrt::IndicatorFields::STATE_EVENT.

Sets V49 Standard and Spec Compliance Number (See V49.2 spec Section 9.10.3) 0x00000001 => V49.0 0x00000002 => V49.1 0x00000003 => V49A (which implies V49.0 and V49.1) 0x00000004 => V49.2.
